channel.title: Bethel University Staff and Faculty Openings
channel.description: A listing of the current staff and faculty openings at Bethel University

item.title: Master Electrician
item.description: Maintain the electrical and lighting systems throughout the college campus to provide safe, efficient and comfortable environment for students, staff and guests. Insures diagnosis and correction of problems and issues as they occur.

item.title: Senior Systems Administrator
item.description: Leads the evaluation of existing systems and technologies and development of strategic solutions, documenting relevant deployment models or views that show how the current and future needs of Bethel University’s IT infrastructure will be met in an efficient, sustainable, agile, and adaptable manner.

item.title: Director of Student Activities & Campus Engagement
item.description: Develop and provide oversight to the Bethel University College of Arts & Sciences (CAS) student programming including, but not limited to oversight of Bethel Student Government, oversight of the Loft space in Brushaber Commons and co-advising administratively for the Clarion student newspaper. Share responsibilities with Student Life deans for mentoring, discipline, and assisting students with personal and education related issues.

item.title: Assistant Men's Hockey Coach/Assistant Rec Sports Supervisor/Club Liason
item.description: Assist the Head Coach as requested in recruiting, training and coaching members of the sport team. The assistant coach is expected to mentor student athletes in their holistic development, including nurturing their spiritual formation, giving attention to their physical well-being, monitoring their academic progress, and facilitating a team culture that produces vitality resulting in a high level of student athlete satisfaction and competitive success. Assist in overseeing all functions of the Rec Sports program.

item.title: Enrollment Counselor
item.description: Recruits new and/or returning students for Bethel University through identifying, qualifying, and cultivating prospective students.

item.title: Residence Life Administrative Assistant
item.description: The Residence Life Administrative Assistant will work with the Housing Specialist to organize several housing and residence life processes; develop an expert knowledge of housing software and provide departmental support for administrative processes.

item.title: Assistant Dean for Residence Life
item.description: This is a live-in position. Responsible for supervising and supporting the RD staff, their duties and the residents in their areas. Foster a positive, safe and educational residential environment for all students by facilitating community, offering direction to programming, and journeying with students through crisis, community standard infractions and personal and spiritual development

item.title: Transfer Evaluation Specialist
item.description: Responsible for managing a comprehensive system of transfer evaluations for prospective and current students.

item.title: Graduate Assistant Coach in Men's Basketball
item.description: Assist the Head Coach as requested in coaching, training and recruiting members of the sport team.

item.title: Graduate Assistant Coach in Women's Basketball
item.description: Assist the Head Coach as requested in coaching, training and recruiting members of the sport team.

item.title: 3rd Shift Nightwatch Custodian
item.description: Support the mission and values of Bethel University by performing custodial and security services to the academic buildings.

item.title: Human Resources Assistant
item.description: Responsible for the support of day-to-day human resources operations.

item.title: Manager, Human Resources Operations
item.description: Responsible for the overall strategic oversight and administration of employee benefits, payroll, and human resources information systems functions.

item.title: Administrative Assistant
item.description: Provide administrative support to the Chief Financial Officer (CFO) and Chief Diversity Officer (CDO), and their respective offices and backup support to the Executive Vice President and Provost.

item.title: Student Success Advisor
item.description: Responsible for providing a first point of contact for student counsel and support in both curricular and co-curricular domains, and for the proactive cultivation of substantive relationships with students for the purpose of supporting their overall success through the completion of their academic program.

item.title: Transfer Evaluation Specialist
item.description: Serves as point of contact for transfer evaluation and prior learning assessment.

item.title: Student Success Advisor
item.description: Responsible for providing a first point of contact for student counsel and support in both curricular and co-curricular domains, and for the proactive cultivation of substantive relationships with students for the purpose of supporting their overall success through the completion of their academic program.

item.title: Resident Hall Custodian
item.description: Perform duties of a custodian, as well as others duties related to Facilities Management operations as assigned by the Housing Lead Supervisor and the Manager of Building Services.

item.title: Resident Hall Custodian
item.description: Perform duties of a custodian, as well as others duties related to Facilities Management operations as assigned by the Housing Lead Supervisor and the Manager of Building Services.

item.title: ITS Project Manager
item.description: Responsible for all project phases (Initiate, Plan, Execute, Monitor & Control and Close) to deliver accurate and consistent Information Technology Services projects.

item.title: Head Men's Golf Coach
item.description: Responsible for recruiting, training, and coaching members of the men’s golf team. The head coach is expected to mentor student athletes in their holistic development, including nurturing their spiritual formation, giving attention to their physical wellbeing, monitoring their academic progress, and facilitating a team culture that produces vitality resulting in a high level of student athlete satisfaction and competitive success.

item.title: Administrative Project and Planning Coordinator
item.description: Provide administrative support, coordination and day-to-day management for CIO and Information Technology Services.

item.title: BUILD Residential Supervisor- Year One & Year Two
item.description: To oversee the residential components of the BUILD program, supervise Housing Mentors, and assist with community and independent living skill development as well as conflict management. Currently has two open positions (One for Year 1 students and the other for Year 2 students). The is a Live on-campus position.

item.title: Associate Dean for Intercultural Programs (ICP) College of Arts & Sciences
item.description: Provides leadership and oversight of programs and services to support multicultural students in their social, academic, and spiritual growth. Works in close collaboration with the Chief Diversity Officer and the Office of Student Life to provide educational opportunities for all students to foster and nurture holistic, integrated, cross-cultural community life at Bethel University.

item.title: Internship Supervisor- Year-One
item.description: Provides oversight of year-one internships to the BUILD program in conjunction with the director to ensure that students are able to successfully fulfill the requirements for an Applied Studies Certificate. Manage daily operations related to BUILD program focus on developing employment skills through internship work experiences including working with employers to arrange internships, developing and teaching BUILD Internship lab and year-one Internship and Jobs and Employment Courses, hiring, training, and supervising job mentors, as well as designing and implementing personalized learning process to track student progress in development of employment skills.

item.title: Athletic Trainer
item.description: The athletic trainer works under the supervision of the director of athletic training services and supervises the care of student athletes competing in the University’s athletic program. The athletic trainer is responsible for the prevention, evaluation, management and rehabilitation of injuries within the University’s comprehensive sports medicine program. Athletic Trainers also serve as Preceptors as part of a CAATE accredited Athletic Training program. We currently have 3 open positions.

item.title: Adjunct Faculty- College of Arts and Sciences
item.description: Adjunct faculty members are an important part of our academic programs. Thank you for your interest in supporting Bethel’s commitment to provide high quality learning experiences for our students.

item.title: Social Work Faculty (Tenure Track)/Field Director
item.description: The Department of Social Work invites qualified candidates to apply for a full-time, tenure-track BSW faculty position that includes undergraduate teaching in the Social Work department, field director responsibilities, academic advising, and institutional service.

item.title: Nursing Faculty
item.description: Teaching responsibilities include clinical, laboratory, and/or theory courses working with students in the traditional baccalaureate nursing program. A clinical specialty with relevant clinical experience is necessary; clinical experience in medical/surgical nursing preferred. General faculty responsibilities include involvement in the activities of the department, for example, student advising, participation in teaching teams, and committees.

item.title: Adjunct Faculty - MBA with Healthcare Administration
item.description: This adjunct teaching position is in the Graduate School teaching MBA students in a Healthcare Administration concentration.

item.title: Counseling Faculty (Tenure Track)
item.description: This is a full-time faculty position in the Graduate School (GS) teaching M.A. in Counseling students in the specialty area of Clinical Mental Health Counseling.

item.title: Adjunct Faculty - College of Adult & Professional Studies
item.description: Teach one or more courses in the College of Adult & Professional Studies as assigned by program director.

item.title: Adjunct Faculty - Graduate School
item.description: Teach one or more courses in the College of Adult & Professional Studies and/or Graduate School as assigned by program director.

item.title: Program Director, Doctorate of Physical Therapy
item.description: Bethel University seeks an innovative, experienced leader to serve as the founding program director of Bethel’s planned Doctorate of Physical Therapy program. The program director will lead the design, development, launch, and growth of a successful, high-quality Doctorate in Physical Therapy program. This person must be knowledgeable about and responsible for program organization, administration, fiscal management, continuous review and analysis, planning, development, and participation in the accreditation process.
